comments.value: #The step definitions for the features below are in StrategyStepDefinitions source folder
#This feature tests if AIP exchanges the odd cards and checks the outcome after the exchange
#AIP hand is passed in the "Given" Step
#HTB hand(s) is passed in the first "And" Step
#The testers test the int getScore() method in the PokerStrategy, where the function returns a score for each hand
#Logically the stronger is the player hand the higher should be the returned score
#The testers test the various strategy methods in the PokerStrategy, to test if AIP returns indices of odd card(s)
#Steps use Assert.assertEquals Junit function to compare scores between poker hands and String returns
#The scenarios in this feature cover lines 105 to 120 on the correction Grid
#_SF stands for straight flush
#_RF stands for royal flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges one card to make a Royal Flush and wins the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Royal Flush W
HTB_SF is given a Straight Flush L
AIP_RF exchanges the odd Card with the right card "S10"
AIP_RF should win the game

comments.value: #_SF stands for straight flush
#_RF stands for royal flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges one card to make a Royal Flush and loses the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Royal Flush L
HTB_SF is given a Straight Flush W
AIP_RF exchanges the odd Card with another card "H2"
AIP_RF should lose the game

comments.value: #_FK stands for four of kind
#_SF stands for straight flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges one card to make a Straight Flush and wins the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Straight Flush W
HTB_FK is given a Four of a Kind L
AIP_SF exchanges the odd Card with the right card "S7"
AIP_SF should win the game

comments.value: #_FK stands for four of kind
#_SF stands for straight flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges one card to make a Straight Flush and loses the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Straight Flush L
HTB_FK is given a Four of a Kind W
AIP_SF exchanges the odd Card with another card "H2"
AIP_SF should lose the game

comments.value: #_F stands for flush
#_FH stands for full house
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges lowest odd card to make it a Full House and wins the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Full House W
HTB_F is given a Flush L
AIP_FH exchanges the odd Card with the right card "D9"
AIP_FH should win the game

comments.value: #_F stands for flush
#_FH stands for full house
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges lowest odd card to make it a Full House and loses the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from a Full House L
HTB_F is given a Flush W
AIP_FH exchanges the odd Card with another card "H2"
AIP_FH should lose the game

comments.value: #_TP stands for two pair
#_FH stands for full house
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges odd card of a two pair to make it a Full House and wins the game

steps.name: AIP has a two pair W
HTB_F_TP is given a Flush L
AIP_FH_TP exchanges the odd Card of the two pair with the right card "CJ"
AIP_FH_TP should win the game

comments.value: #_F stands for flush
#_TP stands for two pair
#_FH stands for full house
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges odd card of a two pair to make it a Full House and wins the game

steps.name: AIP has a two pair W
HTB_F_TP is given a Flush L
AIP_FH_TP exchanges the odd Card of the two pair with the right card "CJ"
AIP_FH_TP should win the game

comments.value: #_F stands for flush
#_TP stands for two pair
#_FH stands for full house
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges odd card of a two pair to make it a Full House and loses the game

steps.name: AIP has a two pair L
HTB_F_TP is given a Flush W
AIP_FH_TP exchanges the odd Card of the two pair with another card "CK"
AIP_FH_TP should lose the game

comments.value: #_S stands for straight
#_F stands for flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges card to get a flush and wins the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from Flush W
HTB_S is given a Straight L
AIP_F exchanges the odd card to with "H6"
AIP_F should win the game

comments.value: #_S stands for straight
#_F stands for flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges card to get a flush and loses the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from Flush L
HTB_S is given a Straight W
AIP_F exchanges the odd card to with another card "D6"
AIP_F should lose the game

comments.value: #_S stands for straight
#_F stands for flush
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges card to get a straight and wins the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from Straight W
HTB_T is given a Three of a kind L
AIP_S exchanges the odd card to with "CJ"
AIP_S should win the game

comments.value: #_S stands for straight
#_T stands for Three of a kind
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP exchanges card to get a straight and loses the game

steps.name: AIP is one card away from Straight L
HTB_T is given a Three of a kind W
AIP_S exchanges the odd card to with another card "C2"
AIP_S should lose the game

comments.value: #_S stands for straight
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP has three cards of the same suit and exchanges other two

steps.name: AIP is given a hand with three cards with the same suit
AIP_S exchanges the odd cards with two cards "C10 CA"
AIP_S should have a new hand with those two added cards

comments.value: #_R stands for rank
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP has three cards of the same rank and exchanges other two

steps.name: AIP is given a hand with three cards with the same rank
AIP_R exchanges the odd cards with two new cards "D9 C10"
AIP_R should have a new hand with those two added cards

comments.value: #_P stands for pair
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP has a pair and it exchanges the three other cards

steps.name: AIP is given a hand with a pair and three random cards
AIP_P exchanges the odd cards with three new cards "D9 S9 H10"
AIP_P should have a new hand with those three added cards

comments.value: #_H stands for high card
#L is for loss W is for win

elements.name: AIP has keeps two high cards and exchanges the other three

steps.name: AIP is given five random cards
AIP_H exchanges the three low cards with new cards "D10 S10 H10"
AIP_H should have a new hand with those three added cards

name: AIP exchanges card/cards to play HTP

comments.value: #The step definitions for the features below are in AIPWinningStepDefinitions source folder
#This feature tests if AIP holds and beats HTB in multiple scenarios
#AIP hand is passed in the "Given" Step
#AIP hand is held in the first "And" Step
#HTB hand(s) is passed in the second "And" Step
#The testers test the int getScore() method in the PokerStrategy, where the function returns a score for each hand
#Logically the stronger is the player hand the higher should be the returned score
#The testers test the String isStrategyNeeded() method in the PokerStrategy, to test if AIP holds the cards
#isStrategyNeeded() returns the name of the given poker hand if strategy is not needed
#Steps use Assert.assertEquals Junit function to compare scores between poker hands and String returns
#The scenarios in this feature cover lines 65 to 103 on the correction Grid

elements.name: AIP has a Royal flush and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Royal Flush
AIP Holds Royal Flush
HTB is given all the other lower nine hands
AIP should win all the nine games

elements.name: AIP has a Straight flush and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Straight Flush
AIP Holds Straight Flush
HTB is given all the other lower eight hands
AIP should win all the eight games

elements.name: AIP has a Four of a Kind and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Four of Kind
AIP Holds Four of a Kind
HTB is given all the other lower seven hands
AIP should win all the seven games

elements.name: AIP has a Full House and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Full House
AIP Holds a Full House
HTB is given all the other lower six hands
AIP should win all the six games

elements.name: AIP has a Flush and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Flush
AIP Holds a Flush
HTB is given all the other lower five hands
AIP should win all the five games

elements.name: AIP has a Straight and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Straight
HTB is given all the other lower four hands
AIP should win all the four games

elements.name: AIP has a Three of a kind and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Three of a kind
HTB is given all the other lower three hands
AIP should win all the three games

elements.name: AIP has a Two pair and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Two Pair
HTB is given all the other lower two hands
AIP should win all the two games

elements.name: AIP has a pair and plays against HTB

steps.name: AIP is given a Pair
HTB has a high card
AIP should win the game

comments.value: #The step definitions for the features below are in HTBWinningStepDefinitions source folder
#This feature tests if HTB beats AIP in multiple scenarios
#HTB hand is passed in the "Given" Stepand AIP hand(s) are passed in the "And" step for each scenario
#The functions test the int getScore() method in the PokerStrategy, where the function returns a score for each hand
#Logically the stronger is the player hand the higher should be the returned score
#Definitios use Assert.assertEquals Junit function to compare scores between poker hands
#The scenarios in this feature cover lines 19 to 63 on the correction Grid

elements.name: HTB has a Royal flush and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Royal Flush
AIP is given all the other lower nine hands
HTB should win all the nine games

elements.name: HTP has a Straight flush and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Straight Flush
AIP is given all the other lower eight hands
HTB should win all the eight games

elements.name: HTP has a Four of a Kind and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Four of Kind
AIP is given all the other lower seven hands
HTB should win all the seven games

elements.name: HTP has a Full House and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Full House
AIP is given all the other lower six hands
HTB should win all the six games

elements.name: HTP has a Flush and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Flush
AIP is given all the other lower five hands
HTB should win all the five games

elements.name: HTB has a Straight and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Straight
AIP is given all the other lower four hands
HTB should win all the four games

elements.name: HTB has a Three of a kind and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Three of a kind
AIP is given all the other lower three hands
HTB should win all the three games

elements.name: HTB has a Two pair and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Two Pair
AIP is given all the other lower two hands
HTB should win all the two games

elements.name: HTB has a pair and plays against AIP

steps.name: HTB is given a Pair
AIP has a high card
HTB should win the game

comments.value: #The step definitions for the features below are in HandStepDefinitions source folder
#This feature tests if the poker game recognizes all 120 permutations of all 9 hands
#All the 9 hands are passed in as example tables in the given step for scenario
#Definitios use Assert.assertEquals Junit function to see if all 120 scenarios have passed
#Permutation Class in the HandStepDefinitions statically tests each permutation of these hands
#The scenarios in this feature cover lines 8 to 16 on the correction Grid

elements.name: A royal flush hand should pass for isRoyalFlush test in any order

steps.name: A royal flush poker hand in any order
I should get true for royal flush in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A straight flush hand should pass for isStraightFlush test in any order

steps.name: A straight flush poker hand in any order
I should get true for straight flush in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A four of a kind poker hand should pass for isFourKind test in any order

steps.name: A four of a kind poker hand in any order
I should get true for four of a kind in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A full house hand should pass for isFullHouse test in any order

steps.name: A full house poker hand in any order
I should get true for full house in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A flush hand should pass for isFlush test in any order

steps.name: A flush poker hand in any order
I should get true for flush in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A straight hand should pass for isStraight test in any order

steps.name: A straight poker hand in any order
I should get true for straight in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A three of a kind poker hand should pass for isThreeKind test in any order

steps.name: A three of a kind poker hand in any order
I should get true for three of a kind in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A two pair of a poker hand should pass for isTwoPair test in any order

steps.name: A two pair poker hand in any order
I should get true for two pair in any poker hand permutation

elements.name: A pair of a poker hand should pass for isPair test in any order

steps.name: A pair poker hand in any order
I should get true for pair in any poker hand permutation

name: Test recognize all nine poker hands with all possible card permutations

comments.value: #The step definitions for the features below are in SpecialWinnerStepDefinitions source folder
#This feature tests for winners between AIP and HTP in multiple scenarios
#AIP hand is passed in the "Given" Stepand HTB hand are passed in the "And" step for each scenario
#The functions test the int getScore() method in the PokerStrategy, where the function returns a score for each hand
#Logically the stronger is the player hand the higher should be the returned score
#Definitios use Assert.assertEquals Junit function to compare scores between poker hands
#The scenarios in this feature cover lines 123 to 149 on the correction Grid

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Royal FLush but AIP wins because it has a higher suit

steps.name: AIP has a spades Royal Flush
HTB has a hearts Royal Flush
AIP should win because spades is the higher suit

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Straight FLush but AIP wins because it has a higher card

steps.name: AIP has a hearts Straight Flush with a high card
HTB has a spades Straight Flush with a low card
AIP should win because it has the higher high card

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Straight FLush but AIP wins because it has a higher suit

steps.name: AIP has a spades Straight Flush
HTB has a hearts Straight Flush
AIP should win because spades SF is higher

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Four of a kind but AIP wins because it has the higher quadruplet

steps.name: AIP has a four of a kind with a high quadruplet
HTB has a four of a kind with a low quadruplet
AIP should win because it has the higher quadruplet

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Full House but AIP wins because it has the higher triplet

steps.name: AIP has a full house with a high triplet
HTB has a full house with a low triplet
AIP should win because it has the higher fullhouse triplet

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Three of a kind but AIP wins because it has the higher triplet

steps.name: AIP has a three of a kind with a high triplet
HTB has a three of a kind with a low triplet
AIP should win because it has the higher three of a kind triplet

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Straight but AIP wins because it has the higher high card

steps.name: AIP has a straight with a high card
HTB has a straight with a low card
AIP should win because it has the higher high card Straight

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Straight but AIP wins because it has the higher high card

steps.name: AIP has a straight with a high card
HTB has a straight with a low card
AIP should win because it has the higher high card Straight

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a Straight but AIP wins because it has the higher suit high card

steps.name: AIP has a straight with a high suit card
HTB has a straight with a low suit card
AIP should win because it has the higher suit high card Straight

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a  the same two pair, AIP wins because it has the higher suit

steps.name: AIP has a two pair with high suit pair
HTB has a two pair with low suit pair
AIP should win because it has the higher suit high pair

elements.name: AIP and HTB have a  distinct two pairs, AIP wins because it has the higher rank pair

steps.name: AIP has a two pair with high rank pair
HTB has a two pair with low rank pair
AIP should win because it has the higher rank high pair

elements.name: AIP and HTB have a the same rank pairs, AIP wins because it has the higher suit pair

steps.name: AIP has a pair with a higher suit pair
HTB has a two pair with a lower suit pair
AIP should win because it has the higher suit among the two pairs

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a high card of the same rank, AIP wins because his card has a higher suit

steps.name: AIP has a high card with a high suit
HTB has a high card with a low suit
AIP should win because it has the higher suit card

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a high card, AIP wins because his card has a higher rank

steps.name: AIP has a high card with a high rank
HTB has a high card with a low rank
AIP should win because it has the higher rank card

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a flush, AIP wins because his flush has a higher high card

steps.name: AIP has a high card flush
HTB has a low card flush
AIP should win because it has the higher high card flush

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a flush, AIP wins because his flush has a higher suit, case one

steps.name: AIP has a higher suit flush case one
HTB has a lower suit flush case one
AIP should win because it has the higher suit flush case one

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a flush, AIP wins because his flush has a higher suit, case two

steps.name: AIP has a higher suit flush case two
HTB has a lower suit flush case two
AIP should win because it has the higher suit flush case two

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a flush, AIP wins because his flush has a higher suit, case two

steps.name: AIP has a higher suit flush case three
HTB has a lower suit flush case three
AIP should win because it has the higher suit flush case three

elements.name: AIP and HTB both have a flush, AIP wins because his flush has a higher suit, case two

steps.name: AIP has a higher suit flush case four
HTB has a lower suit flush case four
AIP should win because it has the higher suit flush case four

name: Determining winners on special hands for AIP and HTB
